description.overview: Apples are the fruit of the apple tree, scientifically known as Malus domestica.
description.habitat: Deciduous apple trees typically grow in temperate regions.

morphology.leaves: Oval-shaped with serrated edges, arranged alternately on branches.
morphology.flowers: White or pink blossoms appearing in clusters during spring.

anatomy.shape: Round or slightly oblong with a stem at the top and a depression at the bottom.
anatomy.skin: Varies in color from red, green, yellow, to combinations of these colors.
anatomy.flesh: Juicy and crisp, ranging in color from white to yellowish.

core.seeds: Contains seeds surrounded by a fibrous central core called the carpel.

cultivation.propagation: Typically through grafting rather than seeds.
cultivation.harvesting: Usually in the fall months when ripe.

health_benefits.digestive_health: High fiber content promotes digestive health.
health_benefits.heart_health: Antioxidants may reduce the risk of heart disease.
health_benefits.weight_management: Low in calories and fat, aiding in weight management.

description.overview: Oranges are the fruit of the orange tree, scientifically known as Citrus sinensis.
description.habitat: Orange trees grow in subtropical and tropical climates.

morphology.leaves: Alternate, oval-shaped leaves with a glossy green color.
morphology.flowers: White flowers with a pleasant fragrance.

anatomy.shape: Round to oval shape with a leathery, dimpled skin.
anatomy.color: Orange when ripe, though some varieties may have different hues.
anatomy.flesh: Segments arranged in a circular pattern, juicy and sweet-tasting.
anatomy.seeds: Contain seeds, though some varieties may be seedless.

cultivation.propagation: Usually through grafting or budding onto rootstocks.

health_benefits.immune_support: High vitamin C content boosts immune system.
health_benefits.heart_health: Potassium helps maintain healthy blood pressure levels.
